case_name: Dr. Rasantha Sanjeeva Abeywickrama vs Postgraduate Institute of Medicine and others
case_subtype: Petition for Certification as Consultant Neurologist
court: Court of Appeal of the Democratic Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
summary: The judgment dismissed Dr. Rasantha Sanjeeva Abeywickrama's application for a writ of certiorari, prohibition, and mandamus regarding his application for Board Certification as a Consultant Neurologist. The court found that the Petitioner did not satisfactorily complete the necessary training as required by the Postgraduate Institute of Medicine (PGIM) and acted within the purview of existing regulations. The PGIM had determined that remedial training was necessary based on adverse evaluations from supervising trainers.
complianceList: The Petitioner must undergo a minimum of three to six months of remedial training as recommended by the PGIM.
The Petitioner must attend any inquiries set forth by PGIM regarding his training progress.
